instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 3476, Short on PP3V42_G3H
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

Working on 820 3476 with short on PP3V42_G3H! 

more precisely i have a short on pin 2 L7095. With my Power supply i put a wire with 1V on pin pin 2 for find the bad component and only heat r8131! But the stupid think is i remove the R8131 and when i put 1v on L7095 the pin 1 off r8131 keeps burning. when i put ?lcool isoprop?lico on area off r8131 i can see the alcohol evaporate at the pin1 off r8131. I don't have others components heating on this board!  

Already replace U7100 for a new one and same history! 

How do I find this short?? 

Thanks

threads.title: 820 3476, Short on PP3V42_G3H
threads.message:
Short inside the board.
Try eliminate it digging a bit down in the board.

threads.title: 820 3476, Short on PP3V42_G3H
threads.message:
Ok, This one can be closed!! i tried to dig a bit but the short don't goes off!! The r8131 it's closed to processor.. the probably to fuck one rail it's high! 

thanks

threads.title: 820 3476, Short on PP3V42_G3H
threads.message: Board is already f**d, nothing to lose...
